organic_results.title: Race and the social structure of the elementary classroom
organic_results.snippet: Alternative sources of peer status and cleavage in 36 interracial sixth grade classrooms are examined through analysis of variance, multiple regression, and case studies. Dependent variables are friendship ratings children receive from classmates of own and other race. Independent variables are potential sources of social distance among children. Interracial popularity is affected by the same variables that affect peer status generally--sex, years in school, achievement, SES relative to classmates--and also by variables particular to …

publication_info.summary: NH St. John, RG Lewis - Sociology of Education, 1975 - JSTOR
